description: College counselor uploads a PDF of study‑skill tips, the platform extracts advice categories, builds a linear SCORM module with interactive checklists and a self‑assessment survey, validates it, and returns a download link.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an AI assistant that helps educators create SCORM‑compatible e‑learning modules from uploaded content. Use the available tools to upload files, extract text, identify key concepts, generate assessments, fetch SCORM templates, populate and validate packages, and finally store and share the completed module.
Hi, I have a PDF of study‑skill tips for college students. I'd like a linear SCORM module that includes interactive checklists for each tip and a self‑assessment survey at the end.
Sure! I’ll start by uploading the PDF you provided.
Got the file. I’ll extract the plain text from the PDF so we can work with the content.

{"text": "Study Skills for College Success

1. Time Management
- Use a planner...
2. Note‑taking Strategies...
3. Test Preparation...
4. Stress Management...
5. Collaborative Learning...","page_count": 12}
Thanks. I’ll now analyse the text to identify the main advice categories and learning objectives.

Great, I have extracted the eight key concepts. I’ll now generate a set of assessment items (multiple‑choice and true/false) based on these concepts.

{"assessment": [{"type": "multiple_choice","question": "Which of the following is NOT a prioritization technique?","options": ["ABC method","Eisenhower matrix","Pomodoro technique","Random selection"],"answer": "Random selection"},{"type": "true_false","question": "The Cornell method includes a summary section at the bottom of the page.","answer": true}]}
Now I’ll retrieve a linear SCORM template to host the slides and the assessment.
I’ll create a slide for each concept, embed a checklist for the learner, and attach the assessment at the end. Then I’ll populate the SCORM package.

slides.title: Time Management
slides.html_body:
Time Management

  • Use a weekly planner
  • Set SMART goals
  • Review your schedule each evening

slides.title: Planner Usage
slides.html_body:
Planner Usage

  • Fill in all class times
  • Block study sessions
  • Include breaks

slides.title: Prioritization Techniques
slides.html_body:
Prioritization Techniques

  • Apply the Eisenhower matrix
  • Use the ABC method

slides.title: Effective Note‑taking
slides.html_body:
Effective Note‑taking

  • Write main ideas in own words
  • Highlight key terms

slides.title: Cornell Method
slides.html_body:
Cornell Method

  • Divide page into cues, notes, summary

slides.title: Test Preparation Strategies
slides.html_body:
Test Preparation Strategies

  • Create a study schedule
  • Use past exams for practice

slides.title: Stress Reduction Techniques
slides.html_body:
Stress Reduction Techniques

  • Practice deep breathing
  • Take short walks

slides.title: Collaborative Learning Practices
slides.html_body:
Collaborative Learning Practices

  • Form study groups
  • Share notes

items.question: Which of the following is NOT a prioritization technique?
